Class MouseInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • com.tv.map.mappanel.Listeners.MouseInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class MouseInput
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    Tyler Valant Listener 1-19-2016 1.0.0

    The Class is for listening to all things mouse

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If the mouse moves into a MapObject, then fire a mouseEnter event on the object. If the mouse has entered a MapObject and now is not in that MapObject, then fire a mouseExit event on that object
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Overrides:
        mouseMoved in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
        Parameters:

        Some mouses are more precise than others. That is why I use the getPreciseWheelRotation and not the getWheelRotation

      • checkObjects

        protected void checkObjects(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        e - the mouse event

        Checks all the objects on the map to see if the event is on them, then dispatches the event to the one's hit

        Parameters:
        e - the event
